reviews.title: Kooza
text: We bought tickets early for Kooza and were glad we did. Prices quadrupled in a month. The show was good for younger ones; the clowns entertained kids. The Asian acrobatics amazed audiences, and the singing reminded me of Dune. Little ones might not want to sit up front due to scary skeleton figures and devils, who performed powerfully on giant roller balls. The tightrope act was good and so was the chairs act. Arriving early is a good idea; parking at the gravel/dirt entrance was pricy ($35-40) but luckily, at Humber Park by Lake Ontario, it was cheaper. The washrooms were port-a-potties with limited refreshments besides, so using facilities before arriving and carrying water bottles was a good idea. Our doors (5-7) at 2150 Lakeshore Boulevard were a further walk toward the rear with stairs; doors 1-3 are better for easier accessible admission near centre-stage and with less crowding at the end. With few benches near security, we found seating under the tent an hour before the show. Thankfully, because of the rush, we booked in advance at a restaurant on the Queensway. Kooza in the afternoon was a fun outing, and the best part was its location close to home!

reviews.title: Cirque Du Soleil Positive review‚Ä¶and fun too!!
text: First of all, this was an amazing work of art and incredible talent!!! The choreography was out of this world and every single one of the performing artists did their job flawlessly and with amazing accuracy! Cirque Du Soleil Is definitely worth a visit and one who has an appreciation of the performing arts will not be disappointed.

reviews.title: Once it's bought, good luck making any changes...
text: Booked a show for clients over a month in advance and had to change it to a show on the following day. Wrote emails, called very day, including the same day I booked the event, and there's never an answer from customer service, even when you register for a callback.  Once you bought the tickets, good luck making any changes or contacting anyone. When you call, you can hit "1" to buy tickets or "2" to contact customer service. I have never been successful with option 2, so I tried option 1 thinking they may prioritize new sales. Could not get through on that line either and am on the phone as I write this, one hour an fourteen minutes on hold. I doubt if the phone line is even staffed. NON-EXISTANT CUSTOMER SERVICE. Close to $900 down the drain. Going to file a complaint with the better business bureau. I'll never attend one of their shows again.

reviews.title: A great show for families
text: Alamuna is a great show, the aerobics and costumes are great and the story is a one of growing up which is common to most people. Worth the cost and travel time.

reviews.title: Fire the clowns.
text: The talented gymnasts risk their lives in awesome show but the stupid irritating clowns seriously detract and almost ruin the show.  With all the negative reviews why keep them?

reviews.title: Loved most of it!
text: Amaluna was very good, I have seen so many cirque shows in Las Vegas, my expectations may be too high.
I loved the music, the story and most of the acrobatics, some routines felt like time killers.
The between the acts comedians were fair, I have seen better and have seen worse was just a little hokey.
The venue was a tent and all the seats seemed great as it is small and intimate.

reviews.title: Amaluna San Francisco
text: Low budget show and boorrriiing! The acts were Long and not entertaining at all I could tell by the audience and applause that it was not that entertaining

reviews.title: Disappointed, not worth the price
text: For the price tag I'd expected a much better show. I've been to a view anf this one was the worst of them. But my dislike might be another's like.
Here is what i and my partner didn't like.

The story, between the good acts, they have two clowns (not actual clowns, but there supposed to be funny) female and male acting out a (very childish) love story. And then there was the real love story between the two 'main' performers. Those stories take away a lot of time from the actual 'circus'. So you're left with very few artistic performances. Wich i actually wanted to see.
Those are however very good thats why I gave it still a 3 out of 5.
I'd understand it if the put on a story between when they have to change equipment on stage, but this was waaaaaay to much.

reviews.title: Wonderful show in Oaks PA.
text: I wanted my niece to have a Cirque Du Soleil before she leaves Philadelphia and so I took her to watch this show. I am a CDS veteran. I have watched the Algeria show in Montreal and by experience I knew she will love it. We were both blown away by the show. My favorite one is the "storm show" in which the performers started playing with bass, guitar and had a rock and roll time! My niece loves the fish tank. I am just so glad that I took her to watch to this show and spend some quality time together.

reviews.title: Great Show
text: We went Sunday for 1:30 Amaluna show at Phila Expo Center in Oaks PA.  We were 5 rows back from the stage semi center.  The view was great, the clowns were great, the whole show was fun to watch.  Lots of acrobatic adventures.  The seats themselves are narrow folding padded stadium seats tightly spaced so are a bit close to the person seated next to you.  That would be the only negative to the show.   We had a bit of heated argument occuring near us which should have had an usher deal with but none were nearby.  Luckily the feuding parties parted ways.  Maybe alcohol should be curbed at this event. Parking was great and close by and they do check your bags and wand over you thru security check.  All of the performers did an amazing "Amaluna" job.  Not sure what all the negative reviews were for.  This is a smaller venue but all of the acts were impressive.

reviews.title: Very odd show
text: This was my first visit to a Cirque du Soleil performance so I had an open mind, but for me a circus is about acrobatics and there wasn't enough of it. The acrobatics there was is great and the performances were top drawer, but the show is padded out with a lot of odd stuff like the portly lady and the Nelson lookalike who just giggle at each other doing a clown like sketch that goes on for ages and is seriously odd. The guitar playing girls don't look like they are playing live and the music and singing almost sends you to sleep. The show doesn't flow and out of the 4 of us that went not one of us rated it. Save your money as it's not cheap for the tickets and at ¬£45 a round of 4 drinks the show doesn't fit the billing.

reviews.title: Fantastic acrobatics, great music and vibe, only negative is the clowning between acts
text: Saw this in Royal Albert Hall in London. The acrobatics (and balancing act) combined with the music and drama was absolutely fantastic. There is one little detail that prevents the show from being perfect though; and that's the "clowning" between the main acts (a silly love / flirtation story). If that act was replaced with a piece of magic (literately, perhaps), the show would be a must see. We had a great time though, and it was kind of funny to see how many of the artists liked the pictures and feedback we posted on instagram after the show. Their performances are stellar, and being present in their world for two hours in the wonderful Royal Albert Hall is inspiring.

reviews.title: Terrible Music!
text: The show is impressive as the moves are breathtaking but music is so "not music but more a combination of noise," and the dancers were shaky and not confident in their stances. May be it was still the affects of December accidents but as audience you can feel that they were not confident. Th Royal Albert Hall is great as always and definitely  deserves better music.

reviews.title: Disappointing
text: We saw this show last night at the Royal Albert Hall. Its the second Cirque du Soleil we have been to. The organisers have lost the plot. The story of a woman coming of age in some distant past did not tie in with the painfully loud contemporary electric guitar music. Of course, acrobats do things that you and I cannot do, but there again they probably can't mend cars or practice law or brain surgery. So we expect top notch acrobatics. Juggling balls, jumping on a see-saw, two learner unicyclists or climbing a pole just doesn't impress anybody who has been to China where amazing acrobatic feats are taken for granted. The best act was a gymnast who skilfully balanced twigs, which left the audience spellbound. I could not see the point of the not so-giant bowl which features so heavily in the posters. The performers merely jumped in and out of the murky water a few times or danced on a platform on top. Finally, the extremely unfunny comedians for the prop breaks were at best seriously bad and at worst the final insult to the audience. They seemed to screech some incomprehensible  language at each other, between poor  crude sexual innuendoes unsuitable for children in the audience. I feel very sad that Cirque du Soleil has come to this. Its what happens when you get big, become a world wide franchise and then sell out to venture capitalists.

reviews.title: Worth every cent
text: Upon visiting other attractions we noticed signs for this in the London Underground and tried our chance at getting a ticket for that night the 17th of Jan.
The show was full of so many amazing feats of strength, acrobatics, balancing, trust, acting all accompanied with amazing costumes, makeup and music.
It was in the Royal Albert Hall and it worked so well in the venue.
Amazing show and amazing performers I would highly recommend going along if you can.

reviews.title: below (high) expectations
text: I have seen many great Cirque Du Soleil presentations over the past years. Especially Kooza, which was a fantastic re-invention of the great artism in Cirque Du Soleil. I have now seen Amaluna in Dusseldorf, and was really disappointed. There are some good artistical presentations, no doubt about that, but the Show as such definitely does not meet the (high) expectations on a new Cirque Du Soleil show. It is in sum - sorry to say - just average, no 'wow' Moment.... and just when you feel on an upward mood, there is this almost ordinary element of the two characters (Lady and Seaman) filling the break and stage remodelling, which definitely does drag the overall Impression down.

reviews.title: This show was amazing!
text: I love the Cirque Du Soleil shows.  This one was under a big top down by the harbour.  The acrobats are incredible and the stage and decorations are so colorful.  Loved the interaction with the audience.  A must see!

reviews.title: Great show
text: Fantastic show with a good size venue, I don't think there was a bad seat in the house! Great outing for a couple or a family, the talent was mind blowing, the acrobatics were amazing to see, nice night out for sure!

reviews.title: Amazing show - one of their best
text: We saw Amaluna under the Grand Chapiteau in the grounds of the Intu Trafford Centre. It was an awesome show and worth travelling for, combined with an overnight stay and a visit to the shopping mall. We have seen several CdS shows around the world and it is one of their best shows. We both rated Amaluna and Ovo ahead of even O, which is resident in Bellagio Las Vegas. Amaluna has some spectacular acts and brilliant live rock-style music. Being under the Grand Chapiteau is a much better experience than being in an arena or a theatre. Highly recommend this show.

reviews.title: Cirque due Soleil is AMAZING
text: I saw Luzia and it was spell-binding.  In their tent everyone has a good view and it is that view that makes you appreciate their skills and art-forms.  I loved the show and would return to Toronto especially to see them again,  I have sen them at other venues but it was not the same,

reviews.title: The show is big disapointment!
text: The show is a big disappointment!
We went to see the Volta show yesterday in Toronto. We go to Cirque Du Soleil every show in Toronto.

The story line, that is usually De-Soleil the biggest point, was not seen at all. Dramatization team has done very badly. Costumes were nothing, looks like company is cutting cost on everything: artists, costumes, performance.
Some performances were performed poorly or unperformed at all, stage was empty, music was playing, and nobody was on a stage - very unprofessional.
End of show was nothing at all, no adrenalin, no emotions. Comics with very annoying.
Few acrobats were good and girl with hair on the rope, other staff was armatures, not Cirque du Soleil level.
At the beginning they say that "show will change our life forever", and it actually did, I will never go to see this Cirque again.

reviews.title: I would not go again - I wasted over $1,600
text: I bought the most expensive non-VIP tickets available last year. 8 of us were in Row 3. They were over $200 a piece.
This is why why I would not go again.
About a third of the people in the two front rows were taping the show almost non - stop.
The lights from their smartphones were a constant annoyance and distraction. I spent half my time unsuccessfully asking people to turn off their cells.

I know C de S asks people not to film. However, the front two rows did it consistently. If I ever attend again and the same thing happens - I will interrupt the show, stand up and ask people to turn off their cells/cameras.
I had 8 very expensive wasted tickets.

reviews.title: Amazing show
text: I have seen Amaluna in Rome few days ago. The show itself is impressive thanks to scenography and the live music.
The artists are all top level and their performances are simply outstanding.
Very recommended show.

reviews.title: Lower quality than previous Cirque du Soleil's shows; comic parts completely unnecessary and annoying
text: I have been to previous shows by Cirque du Soleil and I loved them (Alegria in particular), so I had high expectations for Amaluna. Unfortunately, the quality is low in comparison to other shows; although some parts of the show are impressive, the alleged comic parts were absolutely pointless and annoying, I could not stand anymore the lady screaming. the story line was very basic. Overall, an expensive delusion.

reviews.title: Lazy Production
text: ROYAL ALBERT HALL
While the venue was excellent and the performances were competent, the production itself was bland at best.
Storyline: Boy meets girl; evil tries to separate them; good prevails; they unite.
The story is a very lazy and childish base for this production.

Production: The acts lack continuity and are transparently disjointed. The timing and coordination of acts leaves large gaps between some that are not adequately compensated by the comedy duo who are really just quite irritating.
Costumes: Lively and imaginative. Nothing progressive. No design firsts.

Music: Colossal let down. Normally with Cirque the music carries the production and in the case of "Journey of Man" was an achievement in its own right. The music for Amaluna was little more then white noise. In some places it was almost annoying.
Acts: Flawless performances were let down by lack-lustre, uninventive choreography; cheap sets and a poor production framework. Lacked creatively. Ordinary.
Set Design: Cheap, boring, uninspiring.

I think Cirque have had a great run. Unless they overhaul this genre with completely new ideas, new music and updated themes then its time to bit them farewell. They have been amazing but this show is the beginning of the end. It really was in one word: tired.

reviews.title: Albert Hall disappointment
text: The Albert Hall was a fantastic building and the views were spectacular.

The show was a let down for us some great acrobats and performances by say the lizard (the performer will need to see a physiatrist) he was so into it. Sadly we believed it was padded out and some of the stuff going on was just unconnected and confusing.
We would not return or recommended this show

reviews.title: Amaluna - London
text: I saw this show in London and I thought it was fabulous! It's my 3rd Cirque show and it did not disappoint. I agree with the reviews that the "filler" double act got a bit annoying but it didn't by any means spoil the show. The acts are so talented and there was plenty of variety. Would recommend.

reviews.title: Reasonable evening, but ...
text: We are CdeS old hands, having been lucky enough to see all the original London shows.  By contrast, this was an entertaining evening out, but not a wow, like CdeS has been previously.  It was very safe - none of the original heart stopping high wire acts, for example; and short - two acts of c. 50 mins, each padded out by a large amount of poor quality clowning.   The Balance Goddess was both new (to us) and outstanding, and some of the other acts were good, but overall we thought that the show was missing its earlier spectacular, star attraction acts (we felt that we only got the support acts).  Luckily we got a Club Cirque deal so didn't feel quite as ripped off as we might have, and overall enjoyed our evening.  But the fact that the RAH was probably only half full tells you a thing or two.

reviews.title: Core Acts Great - Production overhyped and unnecessary and Clowns were ...well...Annoying at best
text: We saw Amaluna in London, not Toronto, but its the same - and I need them to understand that I agree with many reviews that the clowning about was really annoying. I get that they need to fill time while the stage is changed between acts but to rub salt into the wounds they actually gave them additional stage time too.

The whole production and choreography is really only for show and to justify the whole company existence and ticket price, but doesnt really add to the spectacle in my opinion. I would have been just as happy, if not happier, just to see the acts in a "....'s got talent".. format just coming on one after the other - but then they couldn't justify the expensive ticket prices.

reviews.title: The worst of the Cirque's.
text: I'm sure the theme for this show was 'keep it safe', and that they did. It was fit for a younger audience, as in teenagers downwards. Some acts took too long, the fillers, which included 2 very irritable clowns, was so damned annoying that I'm not sure quite sure what their purpose was other than to waste time.
The show I watched was in London, not Toronto - but same show.

The show lacks depth and ambition - it feels disconnected. Strongly urge that anyone wanting world class circus talent to see another show.  If you get this on a deal, then why not. But don't pay too much like I did at ¬£70 per ticket.

reviews.title: San Pedro Califoria
text: My mother, friend, and myself attended the 1:30PM show yesterday in San Pedro. We were very excited to go and were looking forward to the experience. I felt you needed to know our disappointment. My mom is very disabled so we purchased the seats where she could transfer from her wheelchair to her seat. All was fine, but the show started and they continued to let people walk right in front of us for at least 20 minutes into the show after it had started. Also there was no enforcing the no taking of pictures with cell phones which was going on all around us. The same happened at the intermission, 15 to 20 minutes of people walking in front of us back to their seats.The music in a word was LOUD, my ears are still ringing today. Unfortunately this will be the last time I go to a Cirque Show.. I feel we were cheated of the full experience

reviews.title: Amaluna at Port of Los Angeles
text: This is a show you will not want to miss. Cirque du Soleil rises to new heights, -figuratively and literally. The choreography is excellent, the artistry of the acrobats is quite breathtaking, the music, lighting... all is spectacular.

The story is set on an island whose name is an amalgam of ‚Äúama,‚Äù or ‚Äúmother,‚Äù & ‚Äúluna,‚Äù or ‚Äúmoon.‚Äù As in ‚ÄúThe Tempest,‚Äù the place is presided over by a sorcerer, only here she‚Äôs named Prospera. With her daughter, Miranda, coming of age, Prospera arranges a celebration. She also provides a worthy suitor by conjuring a storm that shipwrecks a boatload of hunky young gymnasts, from whose midst emerges Romeo.
‚ÄúAmaluna‚Äôs‚Äù female-majority performers ‚Äî including gymnasts who march through like the Amazons of ‚ÄúWonder Woman‚Äù ‚Äî as well as an all-female, guitar-rock band.
For a showstopper, there‚Äôs a genuinely fresh, little-seen act: a demonstration of balance in which a massive mobile, held together by gravity alone, is assembled before your eyes.
Make sure you do not miss this spectacular evening of entertainment.

reviews.title: Be aware of ticket brokers
text: WE have seen several Cirque Du Soleil shows in Las Vegas.  Outstanding.  When Amaluna started to advertise we quickly ordered our tickets.  I noticed a phone number to call for tickets.  I was not aware that this is a phone number for a ticket broker.  I ordered 2 tickets and a parking ticket ($40.00).  was told i had to have a parking ticket for handicap parking.  our total came up to over $450.00.  Talket to a couple of people in oyr section.  they paid $80.00 a piece and $10.00 for parking.  I should have ordered them straight on line.
For first time viwers of Cirque Du Soleil, the show was excellent.  We found the show to be very good (not a Vegas show.
knowing we overpaid for our tickets and parking (reg. $10.00) left us with a very bad feeling.  I will be much more causious in future.  Just be aware of ticket brokers.  They will dopple your price

reviews.title: Phoenix Show 5* +
text: We have seen 4 shows in Las Vegas, 2 in Florida and 3 in Greater Boston and this is up there with the best.  The music was up beat, the comedy outstanding.  All female band, as well as majority of female gymnastic performers.  I loved this show and its cast.  If it wasn't such a long drive from my home in the east valley of Phoenix I would see it again

reviews.title: $70 seats are just as good
text: We really enjoyed the show in Phoenix a lot of very skilled performers we got 2 seat at the end of the isle near center they were the first row of the $70 tickets and we had a great view I don‚Äôt think you need to pay more to get closer it‚Äôs a very small venue I would recommend staying in the center 3 section or there is a couple light towers that might block your view

reviews.title: Great Show VIP Lacking
text: The show was great. I didn't get any of the negatives that other reviewers did. I've seen many Cirque shows and this one was very good. The VIP experience however was less than impressive. It use to be a true VIP EXPERIENCE now its is simply 2 hors d'oeuvres and a couple of drink choices, no personal experiences, very overcrowded and this time they did not even have the photographers taking pictures. VERY disappointing.

reviews.title: So disappointed üòî
text: I completely agree with another Reviewer that wrote: The show was very top heavy on gymnastics you could see at your local gym.
This was my 4th Cirque de Soleil show.  I've seen Varekai, Ka, Kurios, and now Amaluna.
I spent the entire 2 hours waiting to see something that would take my breath away just like in times past. Whether it a performance or just visually.... That never happened.
If others had given it an honest review like the one I'm leaving now.  I wouldn't have gone.  I love Cirque de Soleil and I'm heart broken.

reviews.title: Boring zzzzzz
text: What has become of Cirq?  Since the Volta accident, the danger factor has been dramatically lowered.
The few worthwhile acts were spot on but the show broke character multiple times to showcase two dumb clowns. The music was crazy.
While they were no worthy songs to tap or sing to, the heavy guitar playing made you feel you were at a heavy metal concert. Too much mish mash.
It seems the shows have gone way down in quality since the Chinese bought Cirq. Save your money.
The show was very top heavy on gymnastics you could see at your local gym.

reviews.title: Very Disappointing Show in Chile
text: The show was so disappointing... Unbelievable.. After everything I have heard about Cirque Du Soleil, I expected a great show and it was so regular. Nothing exciting or special.. A small tent and average acts.

reviews.title: Very Impressed
text: Not really sure what to expect as my impression of circus's as a child was not great. However this show was really good at The Royal Albert Hall.
A good mix of skill and slapstick made for an evening of entertainment which is what it is supposed to be.
Some of the acrobatics were truly amazing as were the other floor routines. This is good for both adults and children.
